description:
This course covers the topics in a AP Chemistry sequence. It includes modern atomic theory, periodic table and trends, stoichiometry, bonding, molecular structure, kinetics, thermodynamics, equilibrium, acids and bases, gases, liquids and solids, electrochemistry and solubility. Students and teachers may use this material, which includes video lectures, practice questions and review exams, for self-study. This is a self-paced, asynchronous course. It is meant to be a useful resource without much staff support or involvement. The quizzes and assignments will be auto-graded. While students are welcome to interact with fellow students on the discussion boards, there are no opportunities to interact with the course instructor or staff directly. 

Learn more about our High School and AP* Exam Preparation Courses

Advanced Placement and AP are registered trademarks of the College Board, which was not involved in the production of, and does not endorse, these offerings.
title: Chem.2x: Preparing for the AP* Chemistry Exam – Part 2
